item.description:
www.foxnews.com

item.title: No more late fees for overdue books at LA's public library...
item.description:
ktla.com
Bibliophiles, rejoice: late fees are about to become a thing of the past at the Los Angeles Public Library. That's because the library has decided to end overdue fines on books and other items beginning next spring, Mayor Eric Garcetti announced Friday. When that happens, LAPL will become the largest public library in the nation to scrap the late fee.

item.title: German piglets 'sue over castration'...
item.description:
news.yahoo.com
Little piggies go to market, but in Germany they also go to court. In a legal first, animal rights activists have asked Germany's top court to ban the practice of castrating young male pigs without anaesthetic -- with the piglets themselves listed as the plaintiffs. item.title: County Commissioner's Wife Facing Charges for Pouring Drink on Reporter...
item.description:
allongeorgia.com
The wife of a county commissioner is facing criminal charges after an incident at a budget hearing Friday morning involving a reporter. The woman says the whole thing was an accident, but witness testimony and video evidence show the commissioner's wife saying the reporter 'deserved' it.
